About me:

My name is Juliusz Łosiński and I hold a Master’s degree in Teleinformatics Systems and a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. Currently, I work as a Machine Learning Research and Teaching Assistant at Gdynia Maritime University within the Department of Applied Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence. I specialize in computer vision problems, including tasks such as classification, detection, segmentation, and reconstruction. My passion lies in Artificial Intelligence, particularly in the subfields of machine learning and deep learning. Additionally, I am currently working on a PhD thesis related to these vision problems.

In the past, I focused on rendering computer graphics using various 3D APIs like D3D12 and OpenGL. This experience has equipped me with valuable skills that enhance my understanding of both computer vision and computer architecture.
